meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal slope
meanings.sent1: The hiker followed the isoclines on the map to avoid steep areas.
meanings.sent2: The isoclines on the topographic map helped us understand the terrain better.
meanings.sent3: The isoclines on the map were like a secret code revealing the easiest paths.
meanings.sent4: The isoclines on the map were like invisible threads connecting the same slope points.
meanings.sent5: The isoclines on the map painted a clear picture of the landscape's changes.

meanings.definition: A line on a graph connecting points of equal value
meanings.sent1: The economist plotted the isoclines to show areas of constant profit.
meanings.sent2: The isoclines on the graph indicated where the values remained the same.
meanings.sent3: The isoclines on the graph seemed to dance as they connected equal value points.
meanings.sent4: The isoclines on the graph acted like bridges between equal value territories.
meanings.sent5: The isoclines on the graph made the data visualization more understandable.
